title: Montrose Roselea F.C.
text:
Montrose Roselea Football Club are a Scottish <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Football%20Association">Junior</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> club based in the town of <a href="Montrose%2C%20Angus">Montrose</a>, <a href="angus%2C%20Scotland">Angus</a>. Formed in 1930 and nicknamed "the Lea", their colours are green with a black and white trim.
They were members of the <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Football%20Association">Scottish Junior Football Association</a>'s Angus League and <a href="Tayside%20Junior%20Football%20League">Tayside Region League</a>, before competing in the <a href="Scottish%20Junior%20Football%20Association%2C%20East%20Region">new East Region</a> which they, along with all other Tayside Junior clubs became a part in 2002. Playing second fiddle to the senior <a href="Montrose%20F.C.">Montrose</a>, success has been sparse during their years of existence however in recent years the success has been beyond a club of its size.
The club applied to move from the SJFA East Region to join the <a href="SJFA%20North%20Region">North Region</a>, and this was accepted for the beginning of season <a href="2016%E2%80%9317%20in%20Scottish%20football">2016–17</a>.
Roselea traditionally play their home games at Broomfield Park, a relatively undeveloped facility in the north of the town which has room for around 1,800 spectators. For the 2018–19 season, they have reached an agreement to share Montrose F.C.'s <a href="Links%20Park">Links Park</a> stadium, with a view towards a longer-term arrangement.
